main event: Two USAF pilots reported sighting a brilliant lighted object near Pittsburgh while flying in a T-11 aircraft on 11 February 1952.
interesting points: The observed object was high to the right of the pilots and exhibited a pulsating light,The object was initially thought to be an aircraft but its behavior was inconsistent with known flying capabilities,The sighting lasted approximately one minute before the object disappeared,Both pilots were experienced officers with significant flight hours,The sky was illuminated by a bright moon, allowing for clear observation of the object.
witness description: Major Richard J. Gedeon and Captain George F. Arms, both USAF pilots
